code: cooccurrence_analysis(   data,   covariates,   possible_exposures = ms::pheinfox[, phecode],   weight_var = NULL,   n_cores = 1,   parallel = FALSE,   min_case_count = 20,   min_overlap_count = 5,   evalue = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE,   logistf_pl = TRUE,   detect_separation = TRUE )

title: Perform rapid unweighted or weighted cooccurrence analysis — cooccurrence_analysis
text: data dataset containing outcome, exposures, covariates, , weighted, weight variable covariates vector covariates names possible_exposures vector exposure names weight_var weight variable name n_cores number cores parallelize (default = 1) parallel logical; parallelize analyses (default = FALSE) min_case_count minimum number cases consider exposure (default = 20) min_overlap_count minimum number cases exposure consider exposure (default = 5) evalue logical; calculate evalues (default = TRUE) verbose logical; print notes (default = FALSE) logistf_pl logical; use profile likelihood (TRUE) confidence intervals tests Wald (FALSE) logistf; (default = TRUE) detect_separation logical; use detect_separation (TRUE) skip use logistf regardless (FALSE); (default = TRUE)

title: Perform rapid (parallel) unweighted and weighted (partial) correlations on a matrix — fcor
code: if (FALSE) { data        <- data.frame(matrix(rnorm(100 * 50), ncol = 50)) covs        <- data.frame(matrix(rnorm(100 * 2), ncol = 2)) names(covs) <- c("C1", "C2") wgt <- 1/runif(100)  fcor(x = data, covs = covs, w = wgt, n_cores = 1, verbose = TRUE) }

text: merged table across objects list ...

title: Quickly merge across a list using dplyr-based merge functions — merge_list
code: if (FALSE) { data <- data.frame(   id = letters[1:10],   a  = 1:10,   b  = 11:20,   c  = 21:30 ) data_list <- list() for (i in 2:ncol(data)) {   data_list[[i - 1]] <- data[, c(1, i)] } merged <- merge_list(data_list, verbose = TRUE) merged }

title: PheWAS catalog information — pheinfo
PheWAS catalog information — pheinfo
text: ## `pheinfo` data frame 1,866 rows 12 columns: phecode PheWAS Code (aka phecode) description Phecode description group Phecode disease category group order variable ordering `groupnum` numeric `phecode` value, useful plotting color Phecode group color inspired Okabe-Ito colorblind-friendly palette sex Defines `male` `female` specific phecodes, otherwise `` rollup Indicator whether `phecode` rolls leaf Indicator whether `phecode` leaf (subcode parent code) groupnum numeric value corresponding `phecode` `group` color_original Original `phecode` `group` color scheme phecode_exclude_range Range phecodes disqualify controls given `phecode` phecode_exclude_phenotypes Description `phecode_exclude_range` codes

text: ## `pheinfox` data frame 3,612 rows 8 columns: phecode PheWAS Code (aka phecode) description Phecode description group Phecode disease category group groupnum numeric value corresponding `phecode` `group` order variable ordering `groupnum` numeric `phecode` value, useful plotting color Phecode group color inspired Okabe-Ito colorblind-friendly palette color_original Original `phecode` `group` color scheme sex Defines `male` `female` specific phecodes, otherwise ``
